roleset.name: get smaller, drawing together, shortening
roleset.note: CONTRACT-V NOTES: Member of VNcls other_cos-45.4. (from contract.01-v)
CONTRACTING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry contract.01, OntoNotes grouping contracting-n sense 2; maps to VN class other_cos-45.4. Framed by Claire. (from contracting.01-n)
CONTRACTION-N NOTES: Based on frame for contract-v.01. Framed by Anwen March 2011 (from contraction.01-n)

example.name: all args
example.text: John's pet sea anemone contracted dramatically, from the size of a dinner plate to the size of a fist.
example.arg: from the size of a dinner plate
to the size of a fist

example.name: Arg 1 as "of" PP
example.text: The expanding and contracting of your intestinal tract might cause some indigestion.

example.name: Same syntax, different semantic domain
example.text: The contracting of our profit margin has been occurring all year.

example.name: Arg1
example.text: How do you treat premature ventricular contractions?

roleset.name: enter into a contract
roleset.note: CONTRACT-V NOTES: Member of VNcls hire-13.5.3, settle-89. (from contract.02-v)
CONTRACTING-N NOTES: Based on Ontonotes nouns. Comparison to contract.02. Contract.02 is a member of VN classes hire-13.5.3 and settle-89. Framed by Katie. (from contracting.03-n)

example.name: sentential reason
example.text: But dry growing conditions in the Red River Valley of Minnesota and North Dakota are pushing spot prices of potatoes beyond what Michael contracted to pay last spring.

example.name: with arg2
example.text: John contracted with Mary for conjugal visitation rights.

example.name: arg 1 as thing contracted for
example.text: contracting for the national resources with foreign companies

roleset.name: get, acquire (as of disease), come down with (as a disease)
roleset.note: CONTRACT-V NOTES: Cf. 'recover'. No VNcls. (from contract.04-v)
CONTRACTING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry contract.04, OntoNotes grouping contracting-n sense 2; no relevant mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from contracting.02-n)

example.name: no source
example.text: ``There's no question that some of those workers and managers contracted asbestos-related diseases,'' said Darrell Phillips.
example.arg: some of those workers and managers

example.name: poor John
example.text: John contracted a nasty case of fleas from the neighborhood dogs.

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: The knight's contracting of syphilis occurred on the night of May 12, 1510.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: At this time, the only known Human subject to be incompatible with Flood Infection Forms is Sergeant Avery J. Johnson due to his supposed contracting of Boren's Syndrome from the residual radiation of a crate full of Plasma Grenades.
example.arg: from the residual radiation of a crate full of Plasma Grenades

example.name: awkward
example.text: Jenny's contraction of Legionnaire's Disease really messed up her water polo schedule.

roleset.name: variation on sense two above, enter into a contract with an outside party
roleset.note: CONTRACT_OUT-V NOTES: See Vncls Hire-13.5.3, but verb particle construction has no VN entry. (from contract.03-v)
CONTRACTING_OUT-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes nouns. Comparison to contract.03. No VN class. Framed by Katie. (from contracting.04-n)

example.name: NP reason
example.text: By moving the design of new products in-house -- instead of *trace*-1 contracting out the work -- [the company]-1 also has been able to come up with designs that can be manufactured more efficiently, he said.

example.name: With Benefactive
example.text: [Costa Rican bananas]-2 had been contracted *-2 out early to large corporations.

example.name: the company initiates the contractual work, so arg 0
example.text: The contracting out of work by the company
